original_definition: 'fossil solid fuel' means solid fuel other than biomass, including anthracite and dry steam coal, hard coke, low temperature coke, bituminous coal, lignite, a blend of fossil fuels or a blend of biomass and fossil fuel; for the purposes of this Regulation it also includes peat;
generated_definition: 'fossil solid fuel' means natural or synthetic fuel derived from fossilized organic matter, including coal, oil, and natural gas.

Article 2: ‘fossil solid fuel’ means solid fuel other thanbiomass, including anthracite and dry steam coal, hard coke, low temperature coke, bituminous coal, lignite, a blend of fossil fuels or a blend of biomass and fossil fuel; for the purposes of this Regulation it also includes peat;

‘fossil solid fuel’ means solid fuel other than biomass, including anthracite and dry steam coal, hard coke, low temperature coke, bituminous coal, lignite, a blend of fossil fuels or a blend of biomass and fossil fuel; for the purposes of this Regulation it also includes peat;
Article 9: emissions of NOx by open fronted solid fuel local space heaters, closed fronted solid fuel local space heaters and cookers using fossil solid fuel shall not exceed 300 mg/m3 expressed as NO2 at 13 % O2.
emissions of NOx byopen fronted solid fuel local space heaters,closed fronted solid fuel local space heaters andcookers usingfossil solid fuel shall not exceed 300 mg/m3 expressed as NO2 at 13 % O2.
